messages.content: Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define analyse

Break down in order to bring out the essential elements or structure. To identify parts and
relationships, and to interpret information to reach conclusions.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define annotate
Add brief notes to a diagram or graph.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define apply
Use knowledge and understanding in response to a given situation or real circumstances.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define argue

Challenge or debate an issue or idea with the purpose of persuading or committing someone
else to a particular stance or action.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define calculate
Obtain a numerical answer showing the relevant stages in the working.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define classify
Arrange or order by class or category.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define comment
Give a judgment based on a given statement or result of a calculation.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define compare
Give an account of the similarities and differences between two (or more) items or situations, referring to both (all) of them throughout.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define construct
Display information in a diagrammatic or logical form.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define describe
Give a detailed account or picture of a situation, event, pattern or process. This is usually no more than a small paragraph.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define design
Produce a plan, simulation or model.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define determine
Obtain the only possible answer.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define discuss

Offer a considered and balanced review that includes a range of arguments, factors or
hypotheses. Opinions or conclusions should be presented clearly and supported by
appropriate evidence.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define evaluate

To assess the implications and limitations; to make judgments about the ideas, works,
solutions or methods in relation to selected criteria.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define explain
Give a detailed account including reasons or causes.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define examine

Consider an argument or concept in a way that uncovers the assumptions and
interrelationships of the issue.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define identify

Provide an answer from a number of possibilities. Recognize and state briefly a distinguishing
factor or feature. Shouldn't exceed a single sentence.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define justify
Give valid reasons or evidence to support an answer or conclusion.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define list
Give a sequence of brief answers with no explanation.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define outline
Give a very brief account or summary.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define state
Give a specific name, value or other brief answer without explanation or calculation.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science
Define suggest
Propose a solution, hypothesis or other possible answer.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science for the Internal Assesment
What is meant by "solution" and "product"?
The term “solution” refers to all the work submitted by the student for the internal assessment; the term “product” refers to the completed software only. The product is a subset of the solution.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science for the Internal Assesment
Is there a difference between "developer” and “student"?
The terms “developer” and “student” are synonymous.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science for the Internal Assesment
What is a client?
The term “client” refers to the person for whom the product is being developed.
Definition of key terms in the context of IB Computer Science for the Internal Assesment
What is the adviser of an internal assessment?
The term “adviser” refers to a third party the student must identify to assist him or her in the development of the product.
Commonly used acronyms
What does "IA" refer to?
The IA is the internal assesment, which accounts for 30% of the Standard Level grade and 20% of the Higher Level Grade. There are a maximum of 34 marks to be earned.
